51b13c1c-fba6-4c47-90e1-561fcfcc6ca8.Name: Suraj Sahani

9b366d92-149c-49ca-b130-e4fdb353cf28.Bio:
Sudhanshu hails from Siwan, Bihar, where he completed his early education within his village's bounds. During his JEE preparation journey, he discerned critical gaps in learning experiences, compelling him to pledge substantial changes in India's student education landscape. After graduating from Tezpur University, Assam, with an engineering degree, Sudhanshu departed from his corporate career to embrace the Gandhi Fellowship. This immersive experience delved into India's public education system, shaping his convictions further.
Post his fellowship tenure, Sudhanshu collaborated with the visionaries behind two fledgling education startups. His efforts were pivotal in sculpting their offerings for schools and communities, amplifying their impact. Working closely with students and parents in distant tribal hamlets, he encountered a pivotal challenge—conveying concrete post-program livelihood prospects to graduates. This hurdle catalyzed a profound pause, during which Sudhanshu wholeheartedly dedicated himself to fostering enhanced livelihood avenues.
With a sharp focus on bolstering livelihood opportunities, Sudhanshu endeavours to tackle the root causes of their adversities. His purpose centres on empowering families with sustainable income sources and resources, enabling a transformative shift from their present circumstances. His core belief lies in furnishing these families with the means to uplift their quality of life. By forging this path, Sudhanshu seeks not only to elevate individual lives but also to cascade positive transformations across entire communities. His unwavering commitment is an embodiment of his aspiration to contribute to holistic community well-being.
9b366d92-149c-49ca-b130-e4fdb353cf28.Name: Sudhanshu

e4d24778-a3f7-4539-bb91-25e4826fea20.Name: Aayushi Darshana
Content: Aayushi has been working in the developmental sector for over twelve years and is a voracious “listener” who believes in the magic of inclusion. She is a new mom, learner and dreamer. Her expertise lies in creating synergies between people and their workspaces in not-for-profit sector by tailoring HR functions to the needs of development organisations. During her professional journey, she got to work on various thematic areas like health, education, women and child and disability. A Symbiosis International University alumni, she has completed her Masters in Human Resource Management from the University of Wales, UK. She is currently on her PhD journey because of her keen interest in exploring topics of inclusion and employment of people with special and diverse abilities and works toward creating safe workspaces that are inclusive and accepting of diversity.

I am a passionate social worker trying to create a safe space for every individuals onboard. Looking forward to an amazing journey ahead with a beautiful diverse team.

Content: I’ve been working in the social impact space for 10+ years and I’m in love with NG’s mission, vision and values! Professionally, I’m most fascinated by Behaviour Science (the science of why we do things the way we do them- especially as collectives). My previous experience which informs the work I do here is from Madhi Foundation, Workverse and Suryoday Small Finance Bank (where I was involved in developing learning experiences and managing teams of different sizes in various ways). Please drop me a message on slack if you’d like to talk behaviour science!

I am also the Head of Operations at Tatvam Productions, which is into Films, Photography and Music. I take up freelance projects that involve creative content, theatre, voiceovers, mentoring, branding, and others. I actively advocate for Gender Equality and am a part of various groups/fellowships/programs that help me do it.
